text: - I watched Rogue One over the weekend.
And that final battle scene,
when I saw it, I was like, you know what?
I have to make a Vader shot.
So this is it:
Rogue One Darth Vader shots.

So we start off with corn
syrup and black sugar.

Now I know what you're
thinking, Vader, sugar, Skyy
come on, they don't go together.

Homeboy, with this shot,
you need some sugar.

You probably need to add
some sugar inside this shot.
So we rim our glass with that black sugar,
this got Vader all over.

So we start off with a
little bit of grenadine
in our shots glasses, okay?

We're making three of them
so we go down the line
with my grenadine.
And I come behind that
with a little bit of strawberry liqueur.
Yes, these are both sweet,

the sugar is sweet but you
can see where I'm coming from.
The base of this is black absinthe.
That's why you need that sugar.
Then we hit it with black vodka.

Now I know ya'll say,
that's black, stop there.
No sir.
You hit with vodka,
come behind that with tequila,
come behind that with rum,
come behind that with gin, okay?

I'm trying to give you
three shots in one glass

'cause that absinthe is 80
something percent alcohol,
that is straight fire.
And then we layer that on top of
our little bit of sweetness.
Go all the way up.
Delicious on velvety delicious.
I typically say delicious so I slip.

This is potent as hell but
it can blend a little bit

because when you put
your lips on the sugar
and you chug this down

you get all that absinthe but
it's followed by sweetness
and you have a nice mix.
Garnish it with a little cherry on top.

And there you have it,
Rogue One Darth Vader shots.
You smell this shot before you see it.
That right there, that's in my nostrils
'Cause this absinthe is potent, homeboy.
If you don't have black absinthe,

try like a grape juice
or something like that.
Stay tipsy.
